title: [Self-directed] Pre- and Post-Operative Smoking Cessation Intervention Education: Adaptive Mobile Microlearning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical terminology and foundational patient counseling knowledge
context.additional_context: Conducted in mobile environments using learners' personal devices (BYOD), with real-time feedback systems introduced to enhance interactivity

learning_goals: Learners can explain the five-step process (motivation, nicotine replacement therapy, follow-up management, etc.) of pre- and post-operative smoking cessation interventions.
Learners can develop and practically apply three or more customized smoking cessation counseling scenarios for different patient types.
Learners can establish and evaluate five monitoring indicators to improve smoking cessation success rates within six months.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
